metadata.description:
halong Beach area on the west side of Qilian County, Qinghai Province. The underlying surface is swamp meadow. The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 98.9406E, 38.8399N, and the altitude is 3739m. The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are erected 5 meters above the ground, facing North; the barometer is installed in the pick-proof box on the ground; the tipping bucket rain gauge is erected 10 meters above the ground; the wind speed and direction sensor is set 10 meters above the ground, facing North; the four-component radiometer is installed 6 meters above the ground, facing South; two infrared thermometers are installed 6 meters above the ground, facing South, and the probe orientation is vertical downward; the soil temperature probes are buried respectively at 0cm on the ground surface, 4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm and 160cm under the ground, they are located 2 meters from the meteorological tower in the South; the soil moisture sensors are buried 4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm and 160cm under the ground, 2 meters from the meteorological tower in the South; the soil heat flow boards (3 pieces) are buried 6cm under the ground, 2 meters from the meteorological tower in the South. 
Observed items include: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: Celsius, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit: hectopascal), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: meter / sec), wind direction (WD_10m) (unit: degree), four-component radiation (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watt / square meter), surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: Celsius) , soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watt / square meter), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (unit: Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm , Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage).
Processing and quality control of observation data: (1) Ensure 144 data per day (every 10 minutes), if there is missing data, it is marked as -6999. (2) Eliminate moments with duplicate records; (3) Remove data that is significantly beyond physical meaning or beyond the measuring range of the instrument; (4) Data marked by red is debatable; (5) The formats of the date and time are uniform, and the date and time are in the same column. For example, the time is: 2016-9-10 10:30; (6) The naming rule is: AWS + site name.
For hydro-meteorological network or site information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018). For observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2016年1月1日至2016年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游大沙龙站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县西侧沙龙滩地区，下垫面是沼泽草甸。观测点的经纬度是98.9406E, 38.8399N，海拔3739m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，并距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2016-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。一源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，一源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波 Bowen 比率–能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观察到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米高度的气温、风速和湿度，12米高度的四分量辐射（使用四分量辐射计测量），以及4.5米高度的湍流通量（使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度协方差系统测量）。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获取的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度协方差（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次航空遥感任务，使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.
research objective: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China.
This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.
challenges: However, several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. However, the above modeling efforts suffered from 1) the availability of the forcing data (only two weather stations operated by the Chinese Meteorological Administration functioned in the upper reaches of the HRB) and 2) a lack of high-quality snow and frozen ground data for parameterization.
Unfortunately, this did not work well due to the influence of strong wind. Therefore, snow density data, which can be calculated using snow depth and SWE data, are not available at present.
methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.
dataset: The current study presents a suite of datasets consisting of long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data for investigating watershed science and functions from an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) in China. Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. The updated datasets were released to scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds (i.e., cryosphere science, hydrology, and meteorology), and they are expected to serve as a testing platform to provide accurate forcing data and validate and evaluate remote sensing products and hydrological models for a broader community.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years. Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

A comprehensive snow dataset from the Yakou snow superstation has been updated since the summer of 2013. The observed snow variables included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE) and blowing (drifting) snow. Data obtained from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 are summarized in Figure 4, with additional plots for precipitation, ET, soil temperature and moisture. The datasets are available from 2012/12/05 to 2017/12/31, with intermittent loss mostly due to power loss and sensor malfunctions at high altitudes.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的贡献者，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模和相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进阿尔卑斯地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在阿尔卑斯水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是阿尔卑斯地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，从而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进阿尔卑斯水文研究，国际阿尔卑斯研究流域水文网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领阿尔卑斯地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，阿尔卑斯水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都有可能出现降雪。中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型是临时雪，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。该地区也常见漂移雪，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤含水量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是关于雪和冻土观测的数据，涵盖子流域和流域尺度，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游地区运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在雅口雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和风吹（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次中进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在阿柔冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程，这些数据来自冻土观测超级站。更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景的科学家发布（即冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学），预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂浮雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成、分布式和多尺度的水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Example.AnswerEn: One challenge is the poor availability of multiscale observations which hinders progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes. Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'multiscale observation network' mean in the context of hydrological data collection?

Definition.AnswerEn: Multiscale observation network refers to a system designed to capture data at various scales, from local to regional, using a combination of automatic meteorological stations, eddy covariance towers, remote sensing technologies, and ground measurements to study eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测网络是指一个旨在捕捉不同尺度数据的系统，从地方到区域，使用自动气象站、涡度协方差塔、遥感技术和地面测量的组合，以研究异质表面的生态水文过程。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'gap-free meteorological data' in the context of alpine hydrology research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在高山水文学研究中，“无缺口气象数据”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: Gap-free meteorological data refers to continuous and complete data records obtained from a network of observation stations, ensuring consistent datasets for accurate modeling and analysis of hydrological processes, without interruptions due to sensor malfunctions or environmental challenges.
Definition.AnswerCn: 无间断气象数据是指从观测站网络获得的连续完整的数据记录，确保数据集的一致性，以便于对水文过程进行准确建模和分析，而不受传感器故障或环境挑战导致的中断影响。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection techniques used in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验: 水文气象观测网 compare with those employed in the HiWATER experiment for capturing eco-hydrological processes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验中使用的数据收集技术与HiWATER实验中用于捕捉生态水文过程的技术相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection techniques in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 involve the use of automated meteorological stations to capture detailed atmospheric and soil data, including temperature, humidity, radiation, and soil moisture at various depths, with a focus on continuous and comprehensive observation. In contrast, the HiWATER experiment employs a multiscale observation system comprising eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and various remote sensing technologies, aiming to capture eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface, including aerial and ground-based measurements to enhance multiscale observational capabilities.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验中的数据收集技术涉及使用自动气象站捕获详细的气象和土壤数据，包括温度、湿度、辐射和不同深度的土壤湿度，重点是持续和全面的观测。相比之下，HiWATER实验采用多尺度观测系统，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和各种遥感技术，旨在捕捉异质表面的生态水文过程，包括空中和地面测量，以增强多尺度观测能力。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in the challenges faced when collecting data in alpine regions compared to oasis-desert interactions as observed in the HiWATER experiment?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在收集阿尔卑斯地区与绿洲-沙漠相互作用（如在HiWATER实验中观察到的）数据时，面临的挑战有哪些不同之处？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data collection in alpine regions faces challenges such as cold and harsh climates, high altitudes, and complex topography, which limit consistent data collection and hinder the development of remote sensing technologies. In contrast, the HiWATER experiment, focusing on oasis-desert interactions, encounters challenges primarily due to the poor availability of multiscale observations necessary for understanding eco-hydrological processes in these heterogeneous landscapes.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，数据收集面临着寒冷和恶劣气候、高海拔和复杂地形等挑战，这些因素限制了一致的数据收集，并阻碍了遥感技术的发展。相比之下，HiWATER实验专注于绿洲-沙漠相互作用，主要面临的挑战是缺乏多尺度观测，这对于理解这些异质景观中的生态水文过程至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What insights can be drawn from the methodologies used to separate soil and canopy temperatures in estimating evapotranspiration over vegetated surfaces?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从用于分离土壤和冠层温度以估算植被表面蒸散的方法论中，可以得出哪些见解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The separation of soil and canopy temperatures using methodologies like thermal imaging and radiometric temperature conversion provides insights into their individual contributions to evapotranspiration. This separation helps improve the accuracy of models like the TSEB, which in turn enhances the estimation of energy fluxes in heterogeneous landscapes. Accurate component temperatures are key to understanding the surface energy balance and improving model performance.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 利用热成像和辐射温度转换等方法分离土壤和冠层温度，可以深入了解它们对蒸散发的各自贡献。这种分离有助于提高像TSEB这样的模型的准确性，从而增强对异质景观中能量通量的估计。准确的组分温度对于理解表面能量平衡和提高模型性能至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the limited effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法效果有限的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The limited effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions is primarily due to errors in image classification, which vary with vegetation abundance. This affects the accuracy of deriving component temperatures. Additionally, atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce uncertainties, along with the estimation of incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法的有限有效性主要是由于图像分类中的错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这影响了组件温度的准确性。此外，大气上行辐射和透射率也可能引入不确定性，以及通过树冠估算入射短波和长波辐射的透射率。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, and how does it impact research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么阿尔卑斯地区的观测数据稀缺，这对研究有什么影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in the alpine region is due to the difficulties of accessing these remote areas and technological barriers in data collection. This scarcity impacts research by hindering the modeling and understanding of alpine hydrological processes, thus motivating the development of next-generation observation networks and experiments.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺是由于这些偏远地区的访问困难和数据收集中的技术障碍。这种稀缺性影响了研究，阻碍了对阿尔卑斯水文过程的建模和理解，因此促使了下一代观测网络和实验的开发。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects on data quality when using a suite of datasets combining long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data in the alpine region?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区使用结合长期水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据的数据集时，对数据质量的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Combining long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data can improve the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. It provides accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling and validates remote sensing products. However, challenges such as harsh climates and complex topographies can inhibit complete and consistent data collection, potentially affecting data quality.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 结合长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据可以提高对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。这为水文模型提供了准确的强迫数据，并验证了遥感产品。然而，恶劣的气候和复杂的地形等挑战可能会妨碍完整和一致的数据收集，从而影响数据质量。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of implementing a multiscale observation network in addressing hydrological modeling challenges in alpine regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在应对高山地区水文模型挑战时，实施多尺度观测网络的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing a multiscale observation network helps address hydrological modeling challenges by providing comprehensive datasets that capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. It facilitates the validation of models and remote sensing products and provides essential data for understanding the impacts of climate change and human activities on hydrological processes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施多尺度观测网络有助于解决水文建模挑战，通过提供全面的数据集来捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。它促进了模型和遥感产品的验证，并为理解气候变化和人类活动对水文过程的影响提供了重要数据。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind establishing a distributed and multiscale observation network for hydrometeorological data collection in the upper reaches of river basins?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在河流上游建立分布式和多尺度观测网络以收集水文气象数据的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include providing accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validating remote sensing data, evaluating distributed models, and improving the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. This network aims to address scientific questions regarding effective data integration, simulation, and the impact of climate change and human activities on hydrological processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，以及提高对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。该网络旨在解决有关有效数据集成、模拟以及气候变化和人类活动对水文过程影响的科学问题。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to include both ground-based and remote sensing technologies in the data collection of eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在异质土地表面的生态水文过程数据收集中包含地面和遥感技术都很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Incorporating both ground-based and remote sensing technologies allows for a comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes by providing multiscale observations. This approach addresses the challenges of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, which is crucial for accurate modeling and management of water cycles and resources.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 结合地面和遥感技术可以全面理解生态水文过程，通过提供多尺度观测。这种方法解决了在异质表面上对生态水文过程进行上尺度处理的挑战，这对于准确建模和管理水循环和资源至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What goals are achieved by using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model and validating it with isotopic techniques and eddy covariance measurements in agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型并通过同位素技术和涡度相关测量在农业区域进行验证可以实现哪些目标？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goals include accurately estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration by utilizing soil and canopy component temperatures. Validating the TSEB model with isotopic techniques and eddy covariance measurements aims to improve the model's accuracy in estimating surface fluxes and understanding the energy exchange processes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括通过利用土壤和冠层组件温度准确估计蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。通过同位素技术和涡度协方差测量验证TSEB模型，旨在提高模型在估计表面通量和理解强烈平流灌溉农业区域能量交换过程中的准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multi-scale eco-hydrological processes captured and measured in complex terrains such as oasis-desert interactions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何在复杂地形如绿洲-沙漠相互作用中捕捉和测量多尺度生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Multi-scale eco-hydrological processes are captured using hierarchically nested observational scales. This includes a sparse network of eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and eco-hydrological sensors, along with airborne remote sensing missions that employ LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and thermal imagers to collect comprehensive data across various landscapes and scales.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度生态水文过程通过层次嵌套的观测尺度进行捕捉。这包括稀疏的涡度协方差塔网络、自动气象站和生态水文传感器，以及利用激光雷达、成像光谱仪和热成像仪的航空遥感任务，以在不同的景观和尺度上收集全面的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What specific procedures are employed to measure and validate snow cover and frozen ground data in alpine research regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山研究区域，测量和验证雪盖和冻土数据所采用的具体程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Snow cover and frozen ground data are measured using advanced techniques and instruments at superstations, including snow depth sensors and gamma monitors for snow water equivalent. Soil temperature and moisture are measured at multiple depths, and blowing snow flux is monitored to ensure accurate data collection. Remote sensing products are validated using fine-resolution data from these superstations.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 雪盖和冻土数据通过超级站的先进技术和仪器进行测量，包括雪深传感器和伽马监测仪用于雪水当量的测量。土壤温度和湿度在多个深度进行测量，同时监测吹雪通量以确保数据收集的准确性。遥感产品通过来自这些超级站的高分辨率数据进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the integration of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological research?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使生态水文研究中多尺度观测的整合成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological research has been enabled by advancements in remote sensing technologies, such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, as well as the development of eco-hydrological sensor networks and eddy covariance systems.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 生态水文研究中多尺度观测的整合得益于遥感技术的进步，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，以及生态水文传感器网络和涡度协方差系统的发展。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do ground-based measurement techniques enable more accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration components in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 地面测量技术如何在异质景观中实现更准确的蒸散发成分划分？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Ground-based measurement techniques, such as the use of eddy covariance systems and high-resolution thermal infrared cameras, enable more accurate partitioning of evapotranspiration components by providing direct measurements of soil and canopy component temperatures, which are critical inputs for models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 基于地面的测量技术，如涡度协方差系统和高分辨率热红外相机，通过提供土壤和树冠组件温度的直接测量，使得蒸散发成分的划分更加准确，这些温度是像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型等模型的重要输入。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced in ensuring data quality and consistency in alpine hydrology observation networks, and how are these challenges addressed?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文观测网络中，确保数据质量和一致性面临哪些挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Challenges in ensuring data quality and consistency in alpine hydrology observation networks include harsh climate conditions, high altitude, and complex topography. These are addressed through careful sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, continuous quality control measures, and the establishment of integrated observation networks that include automatic meteorological stations and specialized superstations for snow and frozen ground monitoring.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 确保阿尔卑斯水文观测网络数据质量和一致性面临的挑战包括恶劣的气候条件、高海拔和复杂的地形。这些挑战通过仔细的传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理、持续的质量控制措施以及建立包括自动气象站和专门的超级站（用于雪和冻土监测）的综合观测网络来解决。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in collecting multiscale observations in the alpine region for eco-hydrological processes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers in the alpine region hinders alpine hydrological modeling and associated research. The cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography inhibit complete and consistent data collection, which complicates the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于获取观察数据的稀缺性以及阿尔卑斯地区的技术障碍，阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模及相关研究。寒冷而恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形使得数据收集难以全面和一致，这使得遥感技术和阿尔卑斯水文模型的发展变得复杂。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations could improve the accuracy of hydrological process predictions in the alpine region?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么预计将遥感数据与地面观测相结合可以提高高山地区水文过程预测的准确性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In the alpine region, integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations is considered beneficial because remote sensing data can complement the limited ground observations, despite their uncertainties. This combination is expected to fill the knowledge gap and provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, and allow the evaluation of distributed models, ultimately improving predictive understanding.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，将遥感数据与地面观测相结合被认为是有益的，因为遥感数据可以补充有限的地面观测，尽管存在不确定性。这种结合预计将填补知识空白，为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并允许评估分布式模型，最终提高预测理解。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are current composite temperature separation approaches for estimating evapotranspiration in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前复合温度分离方法在干旱地区估算蒸散发的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The effectiveness of current composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions is limited. The challenges arise from image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance, leading to errors in derived component temperatures. These errors can result in overestimation of canopy temperatures and uncertainties in estimated temperatures due to ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前在干旱地区的复合温度分离方法的有效性有限。挑战源于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，导致衍生的组成温度出现误差。这些误差可能导致对冠层温度的高估，以及由于忽略大气向上辐射和透射率而产生的温度估计不确定性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges in developing remote sensing technologies for alpine hydrological models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 开发用于高山水文模型的遥感技术面临的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The main challenges include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit complete and consistent data collection. These factors hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models and contribute to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集。这些因素妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展，并导致高山地区观测数据的稀缺。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can the integration of ground-based measurements and remote sensing data improve the prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 将地面测量与遥感数据相结合，可以通过哪些方式改善对高山地区水文过程的预测？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integration of ground-based measurements and remote sensing data can improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validating remote sensing data, and evaluating distributed models. Despite complexities and uncertainties in remote sensing data, especially in alpine regions, such integration can lead to a more predictive understanding of hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 地面测量与遥感数据的结合可以通过提供准确的水文模型强迫数据、验证遥感数据和评估分布式模型来改善水文过程的预测。尽管遥感数据在高山地区存在复杂性和不确定性，但这种整合可以更好地理解水文过程和生态系统功能。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets from both ground observations and remote sensing can be effectively integrated for alpine hydrological research.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何有效地将地面观测和遥感数据集整合用于高山水文研究。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets from ground observations and remote sensing can be effectively integrated for alpine hydrological research by using a multiscale observation network. This includes combining ground-based data from meteorological stations, eddy covariance systems, and snow and frozen ground superstations with remote sensing products like LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and multi-angle thermal imagers. The integration is facilitated by validating remote sensing data with high-quality ground observations, allowing for comprehensive analysis and modeling of hydrological processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 通过使用多尺度观测网络，可以有效地将地面观测和遥感数据整合用于高山水文研究。这包括将来自气象站、涡度协方差系统以及雪和冻土超级站的地面数据与遥感产品（如激光雷达、成像光谱仪和多角度热成像仪）相结合。通过用高质量的地面观测数据验证遥感数据，促进了这种整合，从而可以对水文过程进行全面的分析和建模。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the data collection methods used to monitor hydrometeorological and snow cover data in the upper reaches of a watershed using an integrated observation network.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述用于监测流域上游水文气象和雪盖数据的集成观测网络的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve using a network of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations to monitor gap-free meteorological and hydrological data. Snow cover properties are captured using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments at a snow observation superstation. High-resolution soil physics datasets are obtained to capture freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation. The observation network includes seven AMSs and two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, which are used to gather data on wind, air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, pressure, radiation, and precipitation. Snow depth, snow water equivalent, and albedo of the snow surface are measured using specific instruments like the SR50A ultrasonic sensor and the GammaMONitor (GMON).
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及使用自动气象站（AMSs）和超级站网络来监测无缝的气象和水文数据。雪盖特性通过先进的技术和仪器在雪观测超级站进行捕捉。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集用于捕捉冻融过程，来自一个冻土观测超级站。观测网络包括七个AMS和两个用于雪盖和冻土观测的超级站，这些站点用于收集风速、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、辐射和降水的数据。雪深、雪水当量和雪面反照率通过特定仪器如SR50A超声波传感器和GammaMONitor（GMON）进行测量。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please discuss the major challenges faced in collecting and maintaining consistent observation data in alpine hydrology research and how these challenges are addressed.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请讨论在高山水文学研究中收集和维护一致的观测数据所面临的主要挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The major challenges include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography that inhibit complete and consistent data collection. These challenges hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. To address these challenges, a robust observation network composed of automatic meteorological stations, snow and frozen ground superstations, and wireless sensor networks has been established to ensure data collection over various scales. This network provides data on meteorological variables, snow cover, and soil conditions to support model development and simulation. Researchers also utilize remote sensing data combined with data assimilation to improve predictions despite data scarcity.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集。这些挑战妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。为了解决这些挑战，建立了一个由自动气象站、雪和冻土超级站以及无线传感器网络组成的强大观测网络，以确保在不同尺度上进行数据收集。该网络提供气象变量、雪盖和土壤条件的数据，以支持模型开发和模拟。研究人员还利用遥感数据结合数据同化技术，以改善尽管数据稀缺的情况下的预测。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the types of datasets available for studying eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes and their potential uses in hydrological modeling.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 概述可用于研究异质景观中生态水文过程的数据集类型及其在水文建模中的潜在用途。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The types of datasets available include multiscale data obtained from an observation system consisting of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and eco-hydrological sensor networks. These datasets cover soil moisture, leaf area index, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing data, such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer. These datasets are used for parameterization and validation of hydrological models, providing accurate forcing data and evaluating remote sensing products. They support the development of distributed models and improve the predictive understanding of hydrological processes and ecosystem functions in heterogeneous landscapes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 可用的数据集类型包括从观测系统获得的多尺度数据，该系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和生态水文传感器网络组成。这些数据集涵盖土壤湿度、叶面积指数以及超高分辨率的航空遥感数据，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计。这些数据集用于水文模型的参数化和验证，提供准确的强迫数据并评估遥感产品。它们支持分布式模型的发展，并提高对异质景观中水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。
